Y6MbCN-TLvz5zzsF-mh-QQ.text: Yum!  Really tasty little bites.  The chili squid and steamed mushroom spinach (2 separate dishes) were terrific.  Really good service, the server did a great job explaining how and what to order.  The wine list is a little limited, but the tea looked great.  Two of us shared a bottle of wine and 11-ish items for £30 each, I thought it was a great value.  I'm docking one star because the restroom was incredibly musty and dirty smelling.

ud0Sl9PR3uKKKhfrKKiX8w.text: Ping Pong was my first exposure to dim sum and I was absolutely blown away. The Northern Chinese dumplings were like nothing I had ever experienced at American Chinese restaurants, where greasy meat and vegetables slopped on top of greasy rice is the standard. I ordered a delicious apple iced tea to start off my meal, followed by a bowl of the coriander hot and sour soup which was packed with flavor. We ordered a wide variety of dumplings that we all shared and sampled, and they were all wonderful. My favorite were the spicy vegetable dumplings, which contained vegetables, rice vermicelli, chili, and garlic. Yum yum yum! Everything was absolutely delicious. Another plus came from the prices on the menu- Ping Pong was considerably less expensive than a lot of other restaurants in London. The atmosphere was lovely as well- we sat outside on a perfectly temperate summer day and watched people come and go about Marleybone. The server was friendly and enthusiastic, and he was always very quick about offering us refills. Eating at Ping Pong was an absolutely wonderful experience, one that I would recommend to anyone who's looking for a good meal.In short: Ping Pong has good food, good service, and a good atmosphere. What more could you want?

U4Yf-h_JaviFjw-vEEq0kA.text: It was good-- I had their vegetarian sampler for one and enjoyed it.  10 GBP and the "right" amount of food (not too much, not too little).  Recommend this place!

ej6BBWm2CgvmlixlxiuUMg.text: Beautiful stylish modern decor and yummy dim sum in Soho London!

bhHQ00qctggBmGwuupR2eA.text: I think Ping Pongs are kind of like the Starbucks of dim sum land.  It's predictable, reliable and you're usually not too far from one. I can't say I've ever been out on the town and thought OMG where's the closest Ping Pong?!  But, they do have good voucher deals, so check online before stopping in.  Though, that said, they can also do lunch specials and set menu prices that are quite drop-in friendly.  Sometimes when you're out shopping and faced with chain restaurants, a little steamed goodness just sounds like the perfect addition to your triumphant purchases.  If that's what you're after, hop up from Oxford street and get yourself a beer and some tasty little bits that won't totally break your bank.

0DLvRKNJseu0TAVBRdLAaA.text: Good food. A cold dining experience though.  And I always feel like someone has picked my pockets after eating here... I.e it's overpriced.

RrreOyH3s6qZRsVFK5RQIw.text: A fabulous dim sim restaurant - good quality food. The customer service was excellent, I had the set menu, which the waitress adjusted to my dietary requirements, best restaurant service I've received in a longtime. Also the cocktails appear to have a healthy twist in long glasses - really yummy. The toilets are located deep in the basement of this property and are mixed - ladies on the right gentlemen on the left. I don't really like mixed toilets, but its not a deal breaker for me. Overall an excellent evening with great company.

U0EcobujUmblijGgzVm7uQ.text: I cannot get enough of the delicious cocktails in this place, or the seaweed and duck wrap, which is my favourite. Well worth a visit even if just for these.

lHXSX4l5j8LNxK-Mk9V_xg.text: Nice decor and ambience though for some reason the day we went, it was steaming hot, (and I'm the kind of person who has to wear thermals for half the year!)The food was nice but fairly uninspiring. I had a mango and goji juice to start which unfortunately tasted like watered down Rubicon. I do love a good mango juice - but this isn't it :(The veggie set menu for £10 is good value, but the fried bits that come out first were really greasy and set the bar low (especially the potato cakes - this is my favourite easy-to-cook veg and should be a basic dish). The steamed dumplings were much better, but not enough to make me want to come back. I wouldn't say no, but it's not my first choice... soz folks x

Wp9gZx4Qulx_inlaWcJzLw.text: This is an excellent branch of Ping Pong and it holds a special place in my heart due to the fact that I literally bumped into one of my idols, Noel Gallagher, outside! The service, food (I had the deal where you get a variety of dim sum dishes for around £14.99 or so) and cocktails / wine that I had were lovely and I would recommend it. Great location due to its close proximity to Marylebone High St,

Va4LfJG035CVTpKdheCFOA.text: Yes, yes, I know, Ping Pong isn't REAL dim sum.But you know what it is? Generally fast, tasty, and filling when I am on my lunch break and want fairly healthy hot food in my 45min or less time slot.2-3 dishes, and a glass of tea, and I am a happy camper. I tend to try the seasonal specials, and I love the king prawn & garlic dumpling in squid ink pastry. The service at this location is better than what I have had at the others. Friendly, attentive, and they don't look at me funny when I ask for the bill right after my food comes(so I can dash out the door and back to work when I am done). Thanks guys. I've even got a loyalty card. Now I feel like a real yuppie. Please shoot me.

BH7zJtBRAJSqAkfotB0XwA.text: efficient, yummy, and affordable.  I'd recommend the tasting menu it's enough to make you full and it's really cheap! also, their drinks are delicious!

AFlIvvChTZ3jUhtvOOCloQ.text: Asian tapas! Depending on how hungry you are, you can spend a little or spend a lot. This is a great place to go with a date or with a group of people (and share everything). The drink menu is the best! I love the bubble tea and specialty martinis.

FR3H-Da7JSSvCe7wY29M5g.text: For the dim sum purest; forgive me and let me qualify my review - I was disappointed because Atari-Ya was closed, got lost walking around looking for another place, and was famished when I finally ended up at Ping Pong.  It isn't a hole in the wall, traditional, inexpensive, or filling dim sum place, but damn... Thanks Ping Pong for being at the corner easily seen, inviting, and satisfying my appetite.  The tasting menu was not traditional and not as filling but then again, I'm still a newbie Londoner and still haven't adjusted my big American appetite yet.  However, it was still tasty and somewhat creative.  I found the fried stuff was a lot better than the steamed items but again. it was FRIED.  Also, the signature Ping Pong cocktail was pretty tasty.  Next time, I'll try this place on a Sunday for the all you can eat dim sum before my stomach adjust to UK quantities and prices.

4b1pJx0p5nMCHuznpjYTkQ.text: Really nice Dim Sum place. There are a few around the place. Bit pricey but they are TASTY! Cocktails are great too. I recommend if you fancy Dim Sum.

BqSpKpM8dV6EL-nc3XWYvQ.text: Fun place - casual dining place.  Definitely a bit under the radar - with food that was quite good, a strong 4 star.  Service was blah - hence an overall 3 star.  The manager tried to compensate for a very underperforming server - she rolled her eyes while getting water.  If they get this right - I would have given them a strong 4 star.

sOS21UZspxRtLDzynm54jw.text: I really like Ping Pong as it is the perfect place to go with a group of pals and is one of those sociable meals where everyone can tuck in mezze style. The decor is simple, with low seating, dim lighting and square glass tables.We all usually go for selection of dim sum, but I would recommend that if you are hungry or have some manly men with you who enjoy a proper feast, opt for a solo meal. The dim sum is wonderful though, particularly the spicy meat options (there are a number of different types) and the cocktail list is quite extensive. The lavender herbal teas are interesting as come in a glass and as you drink, the leaves expand - the innocent tea became quite the talking point of our table!It does get expensive however as it is easy to get carried away with the ordering so I would recommend you make firm decisions at the start of the meal as to how much you want. Definitely a winner for me though as the place is relaxing, fun and a sociable way to have a meal with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom

5C1xOXyteIvZLJd5WFPk_Q.text: I know everyone raves about Ping Pong, and rightly so. Clean, minimal interirors, funky menus and staff who know the dim from their sum, it's a great place for a first date, or just meeting with friends. All the Ping Pong restaurants have a great vibe, but i really like this one in particular as it's always got a great buzz.Yes, the dim sum are delicious, but to go for a decent meal if you're hungry, it's not great value as I usually get distracted by the relatively cheap price per plate, but having to order copious amounts to feel satisfied.  They have an enormous list of dim sum, with a variety of fillings and they really are divine.  I'd recommend not going in super-starving though, unless you're willing to part with some serious cash!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom

lX2i5XKdM7Qt-CQxN-D8Tw.text: Tiny place where the food is pretty but pretty tasteless. The food is likely reheated after being prepared at some central location for all of its locations. Not so pricey compared to a regular restaurant, but for dim sum, it's pricey.  We had the sticky rice with prawns, seafood dumplings, spicy pork dumplings, honey ribs - bland, bland, bland. Lemonade at 3£ per gets expensive fast. The steamed pork buns were ok - at least they had some taste.My advice - skip it.

Gtj0tcLf_-UNAJEAFAVpeQ.text: This is an awesome place for a romantic meal, drinks with friends, or just a light bite. Although the menu doesn't have as much choice as some other more traditonal dim sum places, the cocktails more than make up for it. As far as quality goes, I haven't had better dim sum anywhere else in London!

86uH1nOM3RVoXQqG0kpYeg.text: There are two floors to this PP so even if it looks busy give it a go if you're passing and looking for some dim sum. The whole chain is all 'cocktail Chinese food' - it's set to quite modern, slightly westernized design and most the clientele are usually local office workers with a smattering of tourist. The colours are much darker and atmospheric than a traditional Chinese restaurant and the menu reflects this in it's more minimalist edge. I think your best bet is to share a few dishes between the people you're eating with as most of the dim sum is typically small and bite size so you can easily mix and match. Prices aren't extortionate but again more than you'd pay in a more just off Chinatown sort of location. Try the jasmine tea after, they serve it so that the plant sort of flower's as you drink it. Give it a go.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom

jeH8lPAhuPJOfn8G0XzaKg.text: My friend and I stopped by here since we were staying at the Mandeville and were craving dim sum. For a restaurant chain I was pretty impressed with their menu items. The best thing about Ping Pong is that they serve dim sum all day! Fantastic. They have all the items that make dim sum amazing (har gao, shu mai, sticky rice, etc.). My favorite item was the duck spring rolls. Yum! They also have a variety of teas which I love. Ping Pong is a great place to get your dim sum fix, but if you want the authentic Asian experience you have to hop on the tube and go to SOHO.

OdKkiDjNM96AXiAiZrEnQg.text: I love dim sum.... But this is expensive. Just get 3 options. And go for lunch!

WMM2980XpsP6Hqy4uUspmg.text: Great Dim Sum in London! I must say this was an amzing dinner I will never forget everything we had was amazing.

XIJYghynN362vyr7w2YBRg.text: What a surprise in downtown London. Best dim sum ever. Highly recommend this place. Their soup will revive you and their dishes transport you back to Asia.

kAYdZVElAIurccvw3ug6aA.text: This restaurant was the perfect place to lose my Dim Sum virginity oh so many years ago and it most certainly left me coming back for more. As a naive young waif back in my first year of university, coming to the big city from a humble country home, I'd never heard of Dim Sum. I remember the evening well, a group of friends (cosmopolitan Londoners) were going for dinner and I couldn't say no. Apprehensive at first, soon all fears were dashed. Ping Pong was the perfect setting, with the wine flowing I began to feel relaxed and comfortable, there was no pressure, I could take my time and say no if it all got to much. Oh how times have changed. Long gone are they days when the mention of a Char Sui bun caused me to break into a sweat, I now need to make regular visits to Ping Pong, I may go as far to say I'm a Dim Sum hussy! Ping Pong can accommodate many a social situation. Be it a working lunch, a flying visit, a meal with friends and family, a date. It suits all. This specific restaurant (there are 11 throughout London) is over 2 floors, ground and basement. The ground floor is alot more fast paced than downstairs. It is dominated by a large round table in the middle which is perfect if you manage to be seated on it but for the other surrounding tables, they are more than a little crampt. In a restaurant where a meal may consist of 6 plates one would hope to have more room that of a TV dinner tray, but ho hum, people that sit here are generally on lunch breaks or in meetings and don't have time to sit around. It works well if you want a fast paced lunch with out feeling like your under pressure to leave. If a more leisurely, relaxed experience is what you are after then I urge you to request a seat downstairs. Although I will take this opportunity to issue a warning, down in the basement area, there are no windows, its cosy and quiet and more than easy to lose yourself in a Lychee Martini or 4 and suddenly forget that you are in central London and have to contend with half of Oxford Street whilst in an alcohol induced daze. However the Lychee Martinis are fabulous and you have been warned! So, on to the food. It's all amazing. I have never had a bad eating experience there. Anything steamed melts in your mouth and leaves you wanting more, I tend to avoid the baked puffs, not that they're bad but more pastry than filling does not a happy Hannah make. The Char Sui bun has the same affect, it is nice but sometimes I feel like I'm eating a cloud to find a little bit of pork. On the other end of the scale the Crispy Prawn Ball is amazing. Once one has worked out how to devour such a peculiar looking entity, it's all good. The squid in Satay sauce is so so good, as are the honey glazed ribs. The cocktail list is extensive and brilliant, I find them expensive but then I find every cocktail in London expensive, they are much the same price as anywhere else. The teas are equally exciting. Cheap and they put on a show, what more could you want, a flower emerging from a ball certainly makes me smile, maybe I'm just easily pleased. Still go and try it and see if it has the same effect! Each dish varies from about Â£2 to Â£4 so depending on how much of a pig you are and how much you like your booze it can work out very cheap. Personally, I am a pig and I like a tipple, for 2 of us the bill is usually Â£30. So, whether your a Dim Sum virgin or know your Har Gau from your Shu Mai, go and check this place out, it's a keeper!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom

k3xuSBLz93Nw7WNP22tG2w.text: Absolutely the best, freshest, tastiest and well-priced dim-sum ever! And the vegetarian options are mind-blowing. Their mushroom soup is to die for!! THANK YOU Ping Pong!

iI9LiYb_Rm3zds58Xwns5Q.text: My sister and her boyfriend absolutely adore this place.  I thought it was pretty good for the price (they have an all-you-can-eat deal for weekend afternoons).  Our waiter was funny, and very French.The tea is free leaf in strainer balls, which I liked.The portions are small and flavorful.I'm spoiled since I live right by the largest Chinatown in North America, and have Chinese friends who have exposed me to Dim Sum repeatedly.  Nevertheless, this place was good, had interesting dish options and was great for our party of 6 on a Sunday afternoon.

SJ-wZupA0tVYHwypSyMhEg.text: Near Oxford Circus. Great place for quality dim sum. Definitely worth the price. I'd recommend getting the set menu Sharing Selection for 2. Came up to £34.95 for 9 items! They do charge a 12.5% service charge but the service is friendly. Our favourite item were the spicy chicken dumpling, prawn toast with sesame seed(sauce is bomb.com) and potato & edamame cakes.

t8luFX4Hm5o7WpbKQCJK1g.text: The atmosphere was great, the food tasted fresh and was, for the most part, great/delicious.The staff were very friendly and helpful.The food is a bit pricey, and some items were ok in taste, but not great. Solid four stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom. Pork tenderloin

5rBcU-b1LPScEVwxmECdcQ.text: Usually love this place and have eaten here multiple times. However we had a really bad experience this last time. We were at the bar waiting for our table to be ready and attempted to order a drink. The bartender ignored us calling out to him and continued to make other orders without even acknowledging us. When confronted he got defensive rather than apologising. Set a really bad tone for the rest of the meal.

zVPJZGgeBQL7tsPiODniIQ.text: I've been to many ping pong places. Strangely for a self confessed food freak I had never got into dim dum. We have Chinatown and of course now the trend is huge with various pop ups, restaurants and food stalls in 2016, but Ping Pong was actually one of the first on the scene. It was also my first proper introduction.The first time I went I thought it was amazing. Maybe it still is in that same branch by Carnaby St. Here this branch and I've been to many it was like all the others thought I can't help feel more savvy about what dumplings or dim sum should be. Maybe I've become more in tune with what to look for...a non thick outer casing. The fried dumplings are nice, but the star is the prawn steamed dumplings. It's only this I really like anymore. It's a franchise place now but I can't help but feel they haven't progressed as a brand, especially with their menu. Not to say it's bad at all.To me it represents a quick fun eating experience with friends or partner. Somewhere with very good cocktails and depending on your branch a nice layout. But it doesn't set any benchmark for dim sum. The quality is ok and that's what you get for a reasonable price.

hEB1K_n9srpraT1qONBo4w.text: Stopped for afternoon tea and snacks and got seated right away and waiter was very knowledgeable. Good experience.

4R3R28BNOGiYPwW3rkaXTA.text: The concept of dim sum restaurants is widespread, but few do it with the perfection Ping Pong does. The outside for each dimsum is perfectly thin, yet holds well. A ton of vegetarian options makes it a treat for all vegetarians.

4Ehn7ryVM5kmcvH3wTDBUQ.text: Not sure if this is Chinese or Japanese food.They tried to be a Chinese restaurant but then they served Japanese salad with dim sum. Decoration is Japanese want to be.Meal portion is very small. It's more  for tasting rather than dinner so don't expect to be full unless you order double/ triple each dish.

TWfcbtzocfdPZJLL0wZidQ.text: I've had a dim sum craving ever since I've been in London. We randomly found this place after exploring the shops around the area. We had to wait a few minutes to be seated since it was packed. We had to sit downstairs. It was a little tight space, I'm not sure how they were able to bring all our food without hitting anyone. Anyways, there was a menu that you pick out the food you want so we did that since we were unsure of how this whole process works. Dim sum was amazing, the drinks were amazing. I wish I went back here when I was in London recently. They should have places like this in the states. I will try the set menu next time I"m back in London.

uU39XSJm6NUEFVeErfysgA.text: It's a chain ofcourse, and much of it tastes similar. But if you're in the mood for some standard dim sum (specially on a Sunday!) then it's a decent option.

wito_1KbNWweQoimT4sGVw.text: Excellent food! We came in an hour before closing and managed to have a first class meal served before closing time. The drinks were great some sort of mojito that left us asking for more. The items that were recommended to us were varying enough to keep our interest at a peak. The amazing colours of the food keep you enthralled as you savour the next surprise to come out of their genuine wooden steamboxes. Would highly recommend this place. Amazing food for a reasonable price.

MHtGvIw-UEs72EOwXf_SvQ.text: I love Ping Pong. It's like.. an Asian McDonalds for me, or something.  The food is good and tasty, the service is quick and friendly.They have good beer and a wide selection of food. I tend to go for one of the set menus, Ping Pong selection for one. It's £12.50, amazing value and you get a good range of food. The potato and edamame cakes are... hnnnngh.My only disappointment is that the rice dish that they used to serve with this was a beautiful chicken and broccoli dish and now it's mushroom and vegetables. If I hadn't of had the chicken one, I wouldn't be disappointed, but seeing as I had (and it was so tasty) I do miss it.So, yeah, it's not fancy, but absolutely worth a hit if you're passing and fancy dim sum.

g0JezSeTcVdDFihwMv3pLw.text: Sometimes I just need some Dim Sum. There is something rather special about the little balls of sweet and sour filled joy (buns) coming in piping hot thatched wooden gazebo box. Dumpling of various varieties and sticky rice wrapped in banana leaves. It's the perfect thing to share with a group and this is just what we did. 11 of us at a large round table made it a great atmosphere to "pass that yum thing" around. I was a little dismayed by the prices, though for London, I guess I shouldn't have been too shocked! The menu is pretty big with lots of choices for everyone. I wasn't particularly hungry after a huge lunch so went for the lighter options. I actually was in the mood for veggie things and found a great deal to choose from. I personally ordered the vegetable dumpling soup which came with a gorgeous broth which was warm but not overpowering. Perfect appetizer. I had the vegetarian sticky rice which came all wrapped up. I had some of the chicken dumplings which were tiny parcels of joy and went great with the sauce. I pinched a bit of the little lamb chops off the table which were succulent and gave just enough tug when you tried to rip it off the bone. Also, the beer deal was pretty legit as we got a bucket (yes, a bucket) of 10 beers for like 29 pounds? Next time I go, I am definitely going to pig out on the 29 pound set menu. No contest.

yNLHgq0LO4KaMDX95ILn6Q.text: Came here on Wednesday; it was my first time at any Ping Pong restaurant. Food was lovely, staff were very friendly and I thought it was great value for money. The only thing I wasn't overly keen on was the layout of the toilets, but I think that says more about me than the restaurant.

mRb0Pq167GiUZJFtPNZfbA.text: It is a cold and windy winter Friday in London. You spent some time walking around and it feels like you could use some lunch. There is no better place to go than Ping Pong and have some of their winter warmer lunch. It was one of those places I wanted to go to for a long time. My hubby is not a big fun of dim sum, so I thought that lunch would be a great option. We both chose Winter Warmer lunch - regular and vegetarian option. It comes with 6 or 7 dim sums, rice dish with broccoli, mushrooms and chicken (in regular option), 2 sauces and a tea of choice. I had some lovely jasmine lily green tea. It was a great deal and the food was delicious. It was just what we needed at that moment. It filled us up and brought some strength to face the cold again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom. Jasmine lily green tea

lumaR2zlHOFOPfjZJhOzhQ.text: I have to say that i was really suprised to say how good the food is. I have eaten dim sum all over the world and i have to admit that this tastes authentic and good with a modern twist. The menu is exciting and the drinks are fun. It is a definite must try and i have been back more than 3 times. My favorite are the buns and shrimp dumplings! Try everything! Delicious and cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom. Yummy dimsum!
Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom. Cool cocktail drinks

fZ4z38o0OcWSgK7F2Gl3cQ.text: Found this place while wandering around with a friend. The place is very hip and had some pretty delicious selections. It's definitely not your back-alley Chinatown dim sum place, but a nicer version with some modern twists. We got the selection menu to share, plus a few other things that looked good and we were both happy with everything. Drinks here were great as well!

6tyw-JfsKAhY7hHEcBzp4A.text: Oi Ping Pong! Hurry up and get yourself down to Brighton ASAP!Ping pong is a dim sum lovers wet dream. This little Chinese tapas place IS a chain, but unfortunately we do not have one where I live. Shame Shame shame...This one seems small when you enter, with little tables very close together, but fear not! There's more seating downstairs if it's looking busy. We had a table Next to the most hilarious couple of men I've ever eavesdropped on (not hard - you are very close together) but if I wasn't enjoying their conversation so much, it could of been annoying.We chose a few dishes to share and I would greedily say - about 6-7 should fill you up.We had a gorgeous chicken soup - delicate flavours but still managed to feel wholesome. Then shared a pork bun - so different to anything I've had before but I loved it! We then went on to munch our way through the dim sum menu - mostly steamed. All very tasty. Drinks were quite expensive and annoyingly I had a lovely glass of Malbec and could have quite easily enjoyed another if it wasn't the best part of £8! Not too cheap but thoroughly enjoyed it.Brightonians - the nearest thing we've got to Ping Pong down here is Yum Yum Ninja I believe!

nqg2qxS2RVNfYn6urq5qQQ.text: Ping Pong is taking over the world, and you can see why.The dim sum is excellent; Ive been to a few PP's over the years and they've always given great service (including the time the waiter thought we had ordered too much!).The food is awesome, I'd say on par with dim sum I've had in China and HK, though a *little* pricey. They have a bunch of set menus which is good,inclgood veggie range for the health and environment conscious ;) They do also they do a buffet on Sunday for £21 which I am trying to convince a bunch of mates to come with me to :)I'd recommend evreything from the steamed section cos it rocks!Hmm...looks like today's lunch is sorted then.

gyDoSvMqrv1WamMOHUi-Gg.text: Pretty good for Dim Sum but nothing really special, I would love to try the afternoon tea or all you can eat option.

pSfZNAoYX2d1TZSPam57LQ.text: So delicious. At first I was reluctant to try Americanized dim sum, but I was blown away by how amazing everything tasted. My bf ordered all our food, so I don't remember exactly everything I had, but it was all delicious. I remember ordering a lemongrass drink that was divine. I wish they'd open a ping pong in LA!

O3gqlaXZQvCxzPMcxGXHeg.text: Everything you eat and drink here is a special little creation. I don't care that it's a chain ... it's the best chain ever. I ate here two nights in a row. Oink. Oink. Can I open a Phoenix franchise? The desert needs your dumplings. Wanted: Desperately seeking flowering tea and soup dumplings to enjoy with friends and/or by myself ... because who wants to share?

FUikzmdq00SLd-1KYi9LVQ.text: This place was not kind, so slow, and not good food too. I will not come again here. The server with the short black hair and glasses had very poor manners. We asked her a question and she had no idea what we we're saying so she yelled into my face saying "WHAT" even when we were speaking English. She also shoved a customer and didn't even say sorry. The other one with the pixie cut and black glasses laughed at us when we didn't know that we had to order on a piece of paper. But they didn't even explain that to us So how we're we even supposed to know. So rude. They didn't even welcome us. Also, she was so nice to the customers next to us. I guess She was looking down on us because we were asian I guess and that we can't understand, but jokes on her we came from California. Also even when we werent even done with our food, they were taking our food away. Not only is the service bad, the food is not good. We ate the Roast Pork Puff and it was 4.55 pounds. It was only 3 pieces !! It was not even that good. It is just beef inside a puff pastry. The only thing that was good despite the price was crispy prawn ball which was 5.35 pounds which only has 3 pieces.... The bathroom was so nasty and I feel like they don't clean the bathroom at all !! Overall not a good place. We were a family of 4 and the overall the bill was 28 pounds and we were still so hungry.  Please dont come here. It was a disappointment... P.s. I'm a student in California who came for vacation. Also, I had a B plus in English class and am very passionate about food. So please take this in consideration. Thanks !! Lol this took me 10 mins to write :))

SN12QeVsltCyoJofBtSnsg.text: I'm going to preface this review with the fact that I MAY be a little bit of a dim sum snob coming from a Chinese family. If it were at home I would describe it as "Americanized" dim-sum so I guess I would call this "London-ized" dim sum?? I don't know, you get the point.You order dim-sum on an order sheet. I decided to get the sticky rice wrapped in lotus leaves and the crispy duck spring rolls. The sticky rice was underwhelming, I wasn't a fan of the filling. The duck spring rolls were better than the sticky rice. My big thing was I felt like the prices for the portion sizes and quality were just not good. My two things equalled about 12 pounds including service charge which is a rip off for the food quantity and quality. Service was also SUPER slow. It took us about 10 minutes of sitting there to even get greeted. Definitely not a fan of this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom. Sticky rice
Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom. Duck spring rolls

chWzak9losEgIPmYHnUnDw.text: Came here a year ago with a large group of 60 people (all American). I can honestly say this was the worst Chinese food I've ever had. Maybe it was because they had to serve a lot of people but the restaurant did know about us way in advance. We were all starving and still I could barely eat any of it.

TrfRHrPfGXLK9w8cmXBJmw.text: A light pre-theater dinner. Very good. We had the nuts starter, duck rolls, one shumai and one har gow, the duck salad and pork buns. All were tasty. The duck salad was the highlight. Not inexpensive given the amount of food but it was a perfect amount for us. Seating was a little tight. Didn't know until too late that they have  a downstairs seating area where we could have been a bit more relaxed.

3PVC0NULKjhbq7FPIOfR7g.text: D1 and I became overcome by 'Dumplingus Needextremus' a condition I passed down to her as the carrier of the rare xiao long bao gene.She has been in Pamplona for six months and had the condition in it's worst form.This place is a very satisfactory cure for the dumpling afflicted. Not a patch on Sydney dumpers but good for an urgent fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom

XSqf5PYn5qanbGI_IwtniQ.text: Sadly a bad idea to come here if you want to eat dumpling. No taste, no flavour. Just the feeling to lost my appetite, and also my  money. First and last time

QygP4ZBCnt8IWNtKk0jisA.text: Good point if you're near-death starving and everything else around is closed : food is edible

DbUlYZjER4LuXsmC07MIqw.text: ***Part II of above review***...I should've known that the food here was going to suck when I asked our server for a spoon and he looked baffled at my request. Has this man ever eaten soup dumplings in his life, probably not. Considering the only soup based dumpling on the menu is the xiao long bao, any competent server would know that you can't consume it without burning ones mouth in a deliciously steaming broth that explodes with one bite. I digress...we finish the crappy food we ordered and figured since it's "Lazy Sunday", we might as well order more food as we intend to take advantage of mediocre all you can eat fusion dim sum. "Wow you finished those fast!", Alberto States. He rushingly takes away our plates. Cool, we think. Let's order more, but there's one problem, he took away the pen we used to self mark the menu with the items we wanted. Hell come back we think to ourselves. 5 mins pass. Water glass is now empty. 10 mins pass, still no sign of Alberto. 35 minutes pass: Alberto is seen taking orders from our neighbors, bussing tables, cleaning tables with what appears to be blue windex, and touching food right after. Cross contamination? I hope homeboy washed his hand.In every instance of coming near us, Alberto would rush by us--seemingly to avoid eye contact with us despite us glaring at him. Everytime the man walked by, he stared at his shoe. Reminiscent of my teenage self when I walked by a girl, I thought was attractive. As it approaches the 35 minute walk, we say f*** it, let's just get the check. The total is $47 GBP (would be $50 GBP if they charged us for their Lazy Sunday Special). Another 10 minutes pass and no one seems to even notice we are here. My brother goes up the front to politely ask for the check. Alberto returns with his portable card reader. No longer a confident man who took our initial order. He seemed overworked and tired and did not even bother to ask us about our meal or engage in any meaningful conservation.  All he does is attempt to perform basic math aloud to spilt our bill. A 12.5 percent "optional" service fee is added to our bill. Did this man deserve his tip, no; but who in their right mind would defy to pay it. Anyways the travesty of their "Lazy Sunday" all you can eat switch and bait lunch is over with. I head to the cloakroom to wash my hands. Great it's locked. 5 minutes pass by, I hear a flush and boom...another server exits the bathroom. The look in eye is of disgust. FML this dude just took a massive dump...the remnants of his stool is still in the bathroom. I hold my breath for dear life as it smells like he ate a dead person. Hands washed...I ran out of that bathroom as fast as I could. This place sucks, I think to myself. TLDR: if you want authentic dim sum, skip this place and head to china town. I'm sure any lowly rated place over there is better than this place. Don't trust TripAdvisor...1000+ 4 star average reviews probably written by people who never had dim sum in their life. Make me an Yelp Elite already. My reviews are fire. Peace. Use Yelp in UK my friends.

Jfe9yhDtoSnIzZPNGm2JBg.text: Sadly for us, we told our hotel we wanted a sushi recommendation .. they interpreted that as dim sum recommendation and sent us to Ping Pong.Nothing remarkable here; appears to be popular though as it filled up rather quickly after our arrival.Overpriced average dim sum .. probably should have listened to the kids and left after our first drink.

vl9ZdXd-zk32pXo4S3t4Xw.text: From the street, this place looked empty and sketchy, but once inside, it opens up into a huge, and well-frequented, restaurant. The dim sum was not presented in the way I am used to - on a tray, pushed by an old Chinese woman, and you just grab what you want. In this joint, you order from a menu, like tapas. But it was still good stuff.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom

hC1gv-VjBEq2DVgmX2BnlQ.text: Ping Pong is my love. It's a chain, but I don't care. Who cares if it's delicious and healthy? I've never actually eaten in the restaurant, but I've picked up the take away. That's a pretty good sign though right, because they've packaged it up, and I have to take it home, unpack it, and it's still phenomenal? Yes I think it's a good sign. Anyway, my husband and I like ordering a bunch of dim sum from their menu and just sharing it. The black prawn dumpling is by far the best dumpling ever ever ever. Holy gazolie it's incredible. We also like the mushroom and scallop, veggie, edamame. Really, they're all very good. I also like their soup- thai style mushroom soup- it's very strong with lemongrass but it's really nice. And their rice pot- tofu, mushroom, and black bean rice pot- it's quite big and delicious. Yay Ping Pong. It's got a lot of variety, and yummy, healthy vegetarian/vegan food. Yum. A great option if you're in a hurry but want something that is warm and not terrible for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom. Gogi berry and pumpkin dumpling special

j4JHYRpTp7F6jjkLqxqMNA.text: Went with my family (wife and toddler).Food is good in terms of quality and does the job if your after a slightly eastern taste with western balance. It is not authentic but good quality for what it is.This branch isn't kid friendly, it's too small and the staff don't really know how to help parents.

wOcDuhUCXOrwgwONjsO8Dg.text: It's a Chinese dim sum chain. They serve ok dim sum. The service was slow (what is it with the delay on providing the check in London?)  Went with a bunch of friends for lunch and it was lovely to catch up.  The ribs and chicken skewers were dried out.  The spicy chicken wings were bony, juicy and smothered in a tasty sauce. The edamame had something on them but it was bland. The broccolini had another bland dipping sauce.  The firecracker rolls were spicy but dry.  There was a mystery pork roll thing with a delicious black bean dipping sauce.  There was some other fried roll with two chilli dipping sauce that was otherwise pretty blah. The had lots of refreshing cocktails like yuzu & cucumber and ginger & lemongrass.  We had some dumplings that were moist but otherwise dull. I think that's everything. Lots of sauces. Nothing stunning, a few disappointments and mediocre service.

Nbl1JahM-URUMthQMDQcpA.text: The dim sums were really tasty. The location of the restaurant is quite good as well. We tried the prawn squid ink dimsum, spicy chicken dimsum, mixed vegetable dimsum and the vegetable sticky rice along with crispy aubergine bao which was presented very well and was quite filling too. It was reasonable also. It's a must try for dimsum lovers. Will try the desserts next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom

sd02ey1beOyMKpjZlDnxvg.text: I still love the food from Ping Pong but the service really was dire tonight. As well as very very slow even though it wasn't very busy the waitress was a bit rude - blunt and dismissive. Stillll as always I can recommend the char Sui bun, roast pork puffs and the yuzu matcha cake. Personally think the spinach and beef dumpling is very bland but also enjoyed the potato edamame cake and the veal spring rolls. The special dumplings - 3 different colours - were ok but nothing special. Tasty food but not the usual service

udVy48JzGrtEXd-isSniLQ.text: The food in general was below average. The shrimp bao was decent but pricey 15 pounds for three. All the other dim sum was not great. Pricey for what you get. One positive: The service was fast and good.

qJ7zGMqVLPwe-D-hPi-OpQ.text: Very tiny place. We were two for dinner about 8pm on Monday night. As I walked in, no one at the door to welcome us. Two tables were available, each can sit 4 people. One single customer just finished his dinner and walked out. He was sitting at one of the table. Finally a woman walked to us, But said that we have to wait. She looked over all the 2 people's table, told us to wait till one might finish eating soon, about 10 -15 mins. There wasn't anyone else waiting. There were two tables available. The single customer just had dinner at a 4 people's table!  WTH! They didn't want my business! Leave! I decided to walk to next door "Mole taco bar" what a pleasant place. The service was wonderful! The tacos were very interesting and tasty. The mango cheesecake, yum! Skip this ping pong!

cXaq54ajz5jAXwFn9hqzcw.text: Only a short review: Awesome variety of tasty Dim Sum!We have enjoyed following Dim Sum this evening:- Chicken & garlic Dim Sum (our favourite!)- Duck Spring Roll (crispy)- Char Siu Bun- Beef filet dumplingEverything was really delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom. Beef filet dumpling
Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom. Char Siu Bao
Photo of Ping Pong - London, United Kingdom. Chicken & garlic dumpling

vbkjJIVxCvlLwJv6QAr1UQ.text: Average foodVery expensiveVery very slow serviceThis place has a great location but could do a lot better with quality and service. Its expensive. Family of 4, with 2 kids under 15, will set you back by £95. They add a discretionary service charge of 12.5%. Recommend skipping this one unless you're a good critic on an expense account!
